abstract: Environmental Protection Agency says in 2016 it will tighten guidelines for test that automakers use in calculating mileage advertised to consumers; agency has been imposing penalties on those that overstate their fuel economy ratings; stricter rules could result in lower fuel economy ratings if car makers have not previously fully complied with test.
lead_paragraph: Starting next year, automakers will face tougher guidelines around how they conduct a test used in determining the mileage advertised to consumers.

headline.main: E.P.A. Issues Stiffer Rules on Vehicle Fuel Ratings
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Issues Stiffer Rules on Vehicle Fuel Ratings

snippet: Starting next year, automakers will face tougher guidelines around how they conduct a test used in determining the mileage advertised to consumers.
